ResourceHeader.Description: This level 2B data set from the Global Ultraviolet Imager (GUVI) instrument on board the Thermosphere Ionosphere Mesosphere Energetics and Dynamics (TIMED) mission contains electron density profiles in full orbit increments as netCDF files. F region electron densities as a function of altitude and latitude are derived from the 135.6 nm channel of the GUVI limb data. The 135.6 nm emission at night is due almost exclusively to recombination of O+ ions. Since O+ is the primary ion in the F region, the 135.6 nm volume emission rate is closely related to the square of the electron density. Summaries of estimated peak electron density and total electron content are also given as Level 3 products.

InformationURL.Name: TIMED Mission Data Center at Johns Hopkins University

AccessURL.Name: In CDF via ftp from CDAWeb
